item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, September 6, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Porting systemd to musl libc-powered Linux (63 points | 23 comments)
2. Is Linux collapsing under its own weight? On Rust for Linux (35 points | 102 comments)
3. The Moral Implications of Being a Moderately Successful Computer Scientist and a Woman (63 points | 7 comments)

7. Intuiting Monty Hall (6 points | 16 comments)
8. Async Rust can be a pleasure to work with (without `Send + Sync + 'static`) (69 points | 41 comments)
9. Exercism has 2M users but no money in the bank (16 points | 2 comments)
10. Building a WoW server in Elixir (11 points | 4 comments)
11. Frustrating interactions with the OCaml ecosystem while developing a synthesizer library (4 points | 1 comment)
12. The Internet Archive Loses Its Appeal of a Major Copyright Case (23 points | 23 comments)
13. Clojure 1.12.0 is released (12 points | 1 comment)

21. LazyFS: A FUSE Filesystem with an internal dedicated page cache, which can be used to simulate data loss on unsynced writes (15 points | no comments)
22. How we build forms in LiveView + LiveSvelte (2 points | no comments)
23. An Optimization That's Impossible in Rust (17 points | 3 comments)
24. The Kelly Criterion in Blackjack, Sports Betting, and the Stock Market (1 points | no comments)
